content:
Diagnosis:	Pilomyxoid astrocytoma, right temporal lobe

Management:	2023 March - Subtotal resection
		2023 April-May - Adjuvant radiotherapy 54Gy in 30#

Histology:	WHO grade 2 pilomyxoid astrocytoma
		KIAA1549-BRAF fusion positive

Current Situation:	Routine surveillance

I reviewed [redacted name] in the neuro-oncology follow up clinic today. She remains clinically stable with no new neurological symptoms. Her headaches have resolved following the completion of steroids, and she has maintained good functional status with return to university studies. No focal neurological deficits on examination today. Latest MRI brain (15/4/24) shows post-treatment changes with no evidence of disease progression. Blood tests including renal function are satisfactory.

The plan is to continue surveillance with next MRI brain in 3 months. Will review in clinic following imaging. She understands to contact us sooner if any new symptoms develop.

cancer_timeline.value: MRI brain shows post-treatment changes with no evidence of disease progression

patient_facts.value: Blood tests including renal function satisfactory
Maintained good functional status with return to university studies

status_updates.value: WHO grade 2 pilomyxoid astrocytoma treated with surgery and radiotherapy. Clinically stable on surveillance with no evidence of progression
